alert.note: Alert for Schleicher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 11:26PM CDT until June 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Schleicher. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1123 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, in northeast Schleicher county, north of highway 190. This is about 15 miles east northeast of Eldorado. Movement was east 10 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Adams and The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 2084. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
